items.titolo: Google risolve caos su Gmail: spam ovunque e filtri in tilt
items.descrizione: Google risolve i problemi di Gmail dopo giornata caotica, i filtri spam non funzionavano, e le email finivano nelle cartelle sbagliate. The post Google risolve caos su Gmail: spam ovunque e filtri in tilt appeared first

items.titolo: Perché Microsoft rilascia gli update Windows sempre di martedì?
items.descrizione: Dal 2003 Microsoft rilascia gli aggiornamenti di Windows sempre il secondo martedì del mese. Ecco spiegato il motivo. The post Perché Microsoft rilascia gli update Windows sempre di martedì? appeared first on Punto Infor

items.titolo: American factory worker Robert Williams became the first human to be killed by a robot on this day in 1979 — man crushed by a robot’s mechanical arm at the Ford plant in Flat Rock
items.descrizione: Today marks the anniversary of what is widely regarded to be the first death of a human caused by a robot.

items.titolo: Suspicious DJI clones appear on the market after the FCC banned foreign-made drones — Xtra and Skyrover drones look awfully familiar
items.descrizione: These two companies are selling action cameras and drones that have the same look, performance, and specifications as DJI's products, but they do not acknowledge any relationship with the Chinese drone maker.

items.titolo: Breakthrough wireless transceiver transmits data 24 times faster than 5G connections, reaching blazing 15 gigabytes per second — Researchers demo invention that uses silicon chip to directly send and receive analog signa
items.descrizione: A research team from the University of California, Irvine developed a new wireless transceiver that skipped DACs and used three sub-transmitters to send analog signs from digital data.

items.titolo: OnePlus 15R, meno spettacolo più sostanza. La nostra prova

items.titolo: ChatGPT found to be sourcing data from AI-generated content — popular LLM uses content from Grokipedia as source for more obscure queries
items.descrizione: ChatGPT has been found to be citing Grok in some of its answers, returning recursive results that risks spreading hallucinated or incorrect information.
